website_summaries.verdict: A decent inflatable pool that's reasonably priced and offers enough room for several kids or a couple adults.
pros: Inflates in minutes, thanks in part to the dual-chamber construction
Can hold as much as 198 gallons of water and accommodate several kids or two adults
cons: Side walls aren't strong enough to lean on them
A few pools arrived with punctures

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, simple summer fun!!
customer_reviews.text: Great for two to four adults. Just enough to keep you cool while you BBQ and have some drinks. Set up took 10 minutes, from box to fully ready. A lot of fun for a low price.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Bruner

customer_reviews.title: Use Hairdryer to Easily Inflate
customer_reviews.text: This is a great pool for the price and it easily accommodates a couple of adults or numerous young children. I've read so many reviews talking about the need for an air compressor but one brilliant person suggested a hairdryer with a cool setting. This worked like a charm and the pool was inflated in less than two minutes.
customer_reviews.author: fairmom

customer_reviews.title: Weak side wall that causes collapse and drainage
customer_reviews.text: From the very beginning, this pool has had a "weird" weak spot in it. The one long side collapses out and water spills out. To hold the water in, we have to prop something heavy against that one side. I wish I would've sent it back right away. I would not recommend this pool. One positive it has is that the drain valve is on the bottom, making for easy drainage.
customer_reviews.author: MontanaMama GRG

customer_reviews.title: Whoops, no quality control!!! But....
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box defective! I blow it up, no problem. Then go to plug the drain plug in and there's a large tear at the seam next to the plug making the pool useless. Told Amazon cust support they are sending a replacement, and gotta send this one back. Will update after that..... Can't say I'm surprised about the quality at all, just was hoping to get lucky with a good one. Edit: Got the replacement and so far it's working fine. Upped 2 stars because it's inexpensive and Amazon replaced the defective one without any hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Beard

customer_reviews.title: Lovin it so far
customer_reviews.text: Put it up yesterday with no problems. I bought a 6x8 piece of indoor /outdoor carpet from.a discount store for $10 to put under it on our deck. I used our shop-vac on reverse to inflate it (another customers suggestion) and it took less than 5 minutes. Used it yesterday and today, to sunbathe & cool off in. Bought a 'pool noodle' & cut it in half to float my legs out of the water to get some sun as i read. LOL I'm going to try an air mattress next week in hopes i can float on it for total relaxation. Only gave it 4 stars since it's only been 1 day.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste money on this!
customer_reviews.text: I have now purchased 3 of these, and they always end up leaking! Love the size but when I go out next day on of the tubes is flat and water is drained out. I thought I was just unlucky twice and purchased two bad ones, but after third try....they suck!! Can never find the leak so can't fix! I think that they are leaking at the seams!! Very dissapointed!
customer_reviews.author: Shelley

customer_reviews.title: Received a defective product
customer_reviews.text: After setting this up with air and water I discovered a pin-sized hole that deflated the pool, which is a real bummer since I was hoping to use this for the summer. I've contacted customer support and have yet to hear from them. Update*** The first product I received had a tiny hole in the plastic. Fortunately, I was able to replace it for another. Unfortunately, the second one they sent me was also no good. I’m looking for the source of the issue here, but every time I inflate the pool it deflates.So, I’m still leaving a one star review.
customer_reviews.author: Abraham Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: It was great for one time use. It fit two adults comfortably. The pool was on top of several tarps on a flat surface the ground was checked for rocks. After about a week the sides started getting holes in it which made no sense because no one was out there and nothing was touching it. I covered the holes and more started to appear so I just dumped all the water out and threw it away.
customer_reviews.author: Deriann

customer_reviews.title: Great buy, cheap fun
customer_reviews.text: Great buy, cheap fun, however a very cheap quality. Had two holes after we inflated it. This is the 3rd pool in as many years that I've purchased. They are easy to set up but just as easy to fail. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Dickens

customer_reviews.title: Decent pool but not for $60
customer_reviews.text: I have bought this pool the past two summers for $20. My kids are tough on inflatable pools so each pool has only lasted us one season. I can justify the turnover because this pool used to be only $20 and that was worth it for a few months of fun. I am really disappointed this pool increased in price by 3x in just a year. This is not a $60 pool unless you have angel children who gently climb in and out of the pool and quietly play in water. If you have loud, fun, active children like mine - pass on this pool.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Poor design
customer_reviews.text: Every time someone touched the side the air plugs come undone. Poor design. From day one. The top ring leaks & needs air few times a day. Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this pool so far
customer_reviews.text: We have had this pool for three weeks. It is big enough for two adults to stretch out. It keeps us cool on hot days. We use it about 3 x a week. I am treating it with a 1inch chlorine tab and a floater. I bought a skimmer net to scoop out debris and I also bought the intex cover. So far so good. We find we need to re-inflate it a bit once week. Hopefully it lasts through the rest of hot months. I am in SoCal so we have hot weather through October. The bottom has no padding so recommend putting something underneath.
customer_reviews.author: ZoeT

customer_reviews.title: Plenty big for 2 adults and a 4 year old.
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good! Big enough for adults and great for my grandson. My husband and I, as well as my 4 year old grandson fit in the pool with room to play! Now if we could only get him to stop splashing us! My grandson I mean, not my husband :) The pool seems to be well made and the plastic is thick. It does take a while to pump up with a hand pump, so an electric pump may be a good idea.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Using as a play pin until the weather warms up. Used hair dyer to inflate!
customer_reviews.text: We have had it set up for 24 hours. It was easy to inflate. I just used my hair dryer on low heat and it filled in seconds. It’s held air and been great. My husband, daughter, and self have been inside and leaned up against the sides and I have even put my feet up on the sides like a foot rest. We have not put water it. We are using as a play pin for now until the weather warms up. I would definitely recommend it as a play pin and will update when we fill with water!
customer_reviews.author: Tara Patterson

customer_reviews.title: We LOVED this pool
customer_reviews.text: We LOVED this pool! We did have to return it because we live in a townhouse and it was too much water to drain for our situation. But if you have a house or better area to have it set up- get it! My sons loved it! We were able to go in it with them! The spent hours in it! We did have to add air into it from them going in and out of it, but I didn't see it as a big deal. I really wish we could have kept it- the little plastic kiddy pool we got to replace it- is such a drag and doesn't keep he boys interest at all...
customer_reviews.author: TEXsMom

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy! Horrible and cheap
customer_reviews.text: Horrible, the cap would not stay on to keep the air in.. you barely touch it the top would come off and deflate..even closing the other top would make the top one come off and deflate .. maybe stayed inflated for 2 minutes
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Won't see another summer.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this pool Christmas 2018 with the intent of using it in summer 2019. As of this review it has been opened for 2 weeks. The first few days it was fine. Kept air, drained fine, no issues. I drained it and cleaned it. It got over-filled once and it hasn't been right since. The bottom ring keeps deflating so before my kids can get in it I have to keep adding air and since I'm using a manual pump it's a bitch to do. I can't find a hole anywhere so I'm guessing a seam has a pinhole tear in it which means this pool will be going the way of Old Yeller after this summer.
customer_reviews.author: S.Crews

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it
customer_reviews.text: This thing is definitely worth the $20 we paid. It was easy to inflate with a portable air compressor. It took about an hour with my first compressor, but works much faster with a small compressor with adapter to fit the pool plug. The kids climb and jump all over it and it seems very durable, especially for the price paid. My only slight complaint is the drain plug is hard to open and drains very slowly. Don't keep this thing in one place for more than a day or two or it will kill the grass underneath. All in all a good value for the money & enjoyment.
customer_reviews.author: grahamgg

customer_reviews.title: This pool is nice for the kids to play in on those hot ...
customer_reviews.text: This pool is nice for the kids to play in on those hot days but it takes forever to blow up. I highly recommend doing it in the early morning (before the sun is out and you're ready to use it). It's a decent size so I'm not surprised it took so long, it just made it stressful when my son was chopping at the bit to get in and I was still blowing it up. I probably should have planned better. Overall, the pool is great though.
customer_reviews.author: Ashleigh Sciarrino

customer_reviews.title: Is not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: We bought this pool on 5/20 but didn't start using it until mid June. The air started to leak shortly after it was used a handful of times but still lasted for most of the day when air was added periodically. The pool never remained filled even outside overnight for that matter. But now, one of the seams started to leak also which is irreparable and makes the pool completely useless. We cannot return it anymore since that window closed on June 19th so we're throwing it away. Please do not throw YOUR money away for this seriously inferior product. I'm giving it 2 stars rather than only one because it's not difficult to inflate. M. Wolf
customer_reviews.author: Daisy17

customer_reviews.title: Not even worth $15
customer_reviews.text: I have no clue how to get in touch with the seller, so I’ll put it all here. I knew What I was getting with a cheap kids pool, but I’ve never bought a pool blew it up and it deflates 4 mins later , I couldn’t find and holes or anything wrong with it , but obviously something was, I took it right out of the box and filled it with an electric pump, so no moving it from place to place . Very disappointed!!!! And obviously can’t return since it was already used!
customer_reviews.author: ALLIESMOM

customer_reviews.title: A bit disappointing
customer_reviews.text: The plugs that hold the air in are continually coming unplugged and the pool is deflating. Otherwise this would be fantastic, but instead is very disappointing because you can only fill the water so high of the blues will pop out.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Kane

customer_reviews.title: Not at all durable - 2 different tears within a week.  Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Thought I'd be in good hands with Intex because I've used their air mattresses, but sadly that same durability hasn't been carried over to their inflatable swim pools. Two 3-year-old had two tears in it within a week. Patched the first one which happened where the kids got in and out of the pool by climbing over the edge. The second tear happened in the bottom section below the water surface so it filled up the air section with water and the pool wasn't usable after that.
customer_reviews.author: J Williams

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up and take down
customer_reviews.text: My kids love this pool! I have a 6 and a 2 year old and there was a lot of space for both of them to splash around. I used an air bed pump and it inflated in less than 5 minutes total. You can fill the water to about 1.5 to 2 feet deep and the walls are thick enough to withstand the kids jumping on them. I love that there’s a drain on the bottom so that you can let the water out without having to flip the pool or scoop it out. I’d definitely recommend it for your backyard. I’d say it fits 3 adults or up to 5 kids .
customer_reviews.author: sdwolfe

customer_reviews.title: my best friend this summer
customer_reviews.text: This pool is awesome. Loses a little air over time but that is to be expected and it certainly doesn't go flat. Keeps the water cool. Sturdy enough to sit on the edges. It has been super hot this summer and this is awesome to sit in and relax in the evening. Strictly adult use not kids and it is great. I don't like the maintenance of a full size pool and this gives the relief without the work. I empty and clean with vinegar every few weeks. No issues. Love this pool.
customer_reviews.author: JMWalker

customer_reviews.title: good value
customer_reviews.text: Good size for my kids (age 7, 5 and 4) though we are not a tall family. They couldn't all play at once in it but the water got deep enough that they had fun. I bought it with the air pump to fill it fast and it worked well. I also bought a tarp to put under to keep from sticks poking it and it did not get broken this whole summer. My dogs even jumped on the edges with their paws and no punctures. It's a good value for the cost (about $25 I think).
customer_reviews.author: Christy M.

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this it pops easy.
customer_reviews.text: Pops very easy. Grandkids didn't even get to use it. Filled it up and before the grandkids even got to our house it sprung a leak. My husband went and bought a patch kit. We filled it back up and within an hour it was going flat again. My grandkids were disappointed they couldn't play in it. Let alone the water we wasted.
customer_reviews.author: Cowgirly

customer_reviews.title: Great inflated, just as great deflated!
customer_reviews.text: Great pool for the money. So many reviews already talking about how great this thing is inflated, so I'm just going state how wonderful this pool is deflated! Our first kiddie pool was one of those preformed plastic pools, that was the worst. Our second was a rigid sided pool with a soft bottom. That pool was better, but didn't fold up very small and the hard plastic eventually cracked. This pool deflates and stores away in about 3"x16"x16". Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Great pool cheap price.
customer_reviews.text: My wife operates a daycare and my grandchildren live with us. We have 5 children ages 8 to 3 every day swimming in this pool. They placed a slide going over one end of the pool so they can slide into the water. We have had this pool for about a month now. It is like brand new after being abused by the kids sliding, jumping, and playing with a large amount of toys in the pool. We definitely got our money’s worth with this pool. Still plenty of time to swim left this year. Great pool for the money.
customer_reviews.author: paul conwell

customer_reviews.title: Deflates :(
customer_reviews.text: This would be an awesome pool if the bottom half didn’t keep deflating (I noticed another reviewer had this problem too). For me I guess it’s okay since the pool is for my toddler and baby and I don’t have too much water in it anyways, so we still use it even though it’s halfway deflated. Also a suggestion: if you have a leaf blower, don’t buy the air pump. We just blew up ours with our leaf blower and it works really fast
customer_reviews.author: nn

customer_reviews.title: Price is inflated like the pool
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pool in May of 2019 for $20. I wanted to buy another one for this summer and the price is now $100. Great pool, but not that great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase for the summer!!!
customer_reviews.text: This was the easiest to inflate(I couldn’t find my air compressor and some genius suggested using a hair dryer on the cool setting, it worked like a charm and went up fast!!). The durability is great, you can’t beat it for the price! My mom lives a street away and has a pool but on days where I want to just relax at home it definitely keeps my 5 year old happy and occupied! Perfect for summer!! I highly suggest this pool to anyone! And I’m not sure what happened with a previous buyer but there is definitely a drain plug at the bottom for easy draining!!!
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Deel

customer_reviews.title: Not a good pool
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for my 3 year old son. First time I filled it with air and immediately it began to deflate. The first chamber must have a leak. Upset because I threw away the box with the trash!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Williams

customer_reviews.title: Leaky Tiki
customer_reviews.text: This pool only lasted one season. Last year we used a folded tarp and area rug to cushion and protect the bottom; set it up on concrete patio. At the end of the season we vacuumed all air out, cleaned and stored in large plastic storage bin. This year we tried to set up the pool but have found that it is incapable of holding air; we have to add air every day just to use and have been unable to locate slow leak. Very disappointing. We will not be buying any more Intex products.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin E. Amos

customer_reviews.title: Schwimming
customer_reviews.text: I love love love this pool. I purchased it for just me to cool off in while gardening etc. I'm 5'11" and I can easily stretch out and float in there. I would suggest getting a cover, such as a rubber fitted sheet for bedwetters. I blew mine up using a shop vac and it took all of five minutes. Also, buy a crappy old rug at a thrift to put underneath to avoid punctures.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Crap
customer_reviews.text: This pool began to leak air 2 weeks after it was set up in the back yard. My grandson only played in it 2 times. Since the pool was bought before the swimming season started, by the time it was set up it was outside the Amazon return window. I was told to contact Intex, which I did. They informed me that there was NO warranty on this product. What kind of company offers no warranty for a defective product? I will never purchase anything from this company again.
customer_reviews.author: DRZ

customer_reviews.title: Worps at  85°F.
customer_reviews.text: this pool did not last long at all. My husband and I set it up for the kids, and the size was great, but it started to distort in the sun, and every time we would fillet one side what droop very quickly, and half the water with/out over the side. At first we thought it might have been I were doing in the way we set up the pool so we tried again, but after the second time with the same side having the same results we scrapped it as a bad plan. we had mildly warm days the days we had pool up also. Nothing above 85°.
customer_reviews.author: Candice M. Attrill

customer_reviews.title: Best inflatable pool you can get!
customer_reviews.text: This pool is the ideal small summer backyard pool! It's big enough that two adults can move around quite easily in it, and the sides are very sturdy when properly inflated. I can sit in it and lean on the edge without water pouring out over the edge. I have tried SO MANY inflatable pools, and this one is, by far, my favorite. This year's model also comes with a drain plug in the corner of the floor, which is a good addition. I highly recommend this pool for hot summer days!
customer_reviews.author: Arlo

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this piece of crap - it didn't last one day
customer_reviews.text: I buy so many things at Amazon, and this is the first time in many years that I'm unsatisfied with a product. And let me tell you, I'm not a picky person at all, I'm very flexible and willing to accept a variety of standards. However, this pool is garbage, it didn't last one day. I inflated for me, my wife, and daughter to enjoy, and a few hours later, it was deflating. I contacted the seller, and they told me they don't accept returns or replacement for their garbage products, can you believe that? Don't get into trouble with this seller, it has a bad product and, I hope, I can build its bad reputation. Save your money!
customer_reviews.author: Rafael Teixeira

customer_reviews.title: Large walls take away from actual swim area.
customer_reviews.text: Pool was easy to inflate with a pump. Once it was inflated, the size is misleading. As by my picture I didn't take into account that the walls of the pool are 10inch thick. You lose that in the actual swim area of the pool. So the actual swim area is less 20 inches from the 103× 69 measurement. We purchased for my 2 yr old granddaughter who loves to swim, thinking she would be able to practice with her kick board. It is 22inches deep so she will have fun playing. Can't comment on durability or sturdiness yet. Will update during the summer. Its finally starting to warm up in the 80 here.
customer_reviews.author: Ojones

customer_reviews.title: Broken right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this back in July but just opened it and set it up for the first time and the top plug is torn so it doesn't stay plugged. It's not even something we can patch. I have a really disappointed 7 year old.
customer_reviews.author: Angie N.

customer_reviews.title: Nice pool at a nice price
customer_reviews.text: I like this pool, I purchased it because a friend has one and recommended it. It has 2 air chambers and it inflated quickly with my electric pump. I place 4 layers of 5 mm plastic sheeting under the pool before placing it on a pea gravel surface. We keep a cover on ours and use pool tabs and are able to change water less often. It dried quickly enough when we took it down for winter to put it away.
customer_reviews.author: Seza L.

customer_reviews.title: Its just okay
customer_reviews.text: This pool was a little pricey. It is a nice large pool. It has a fill to line. But i find you cant even fill to the line because the sides start to sag and bow out. And if i fill it up too the point where it starts to sag (not even close to the fill line)theres really not much water in there.Lucky its only for a 2 yr old so he doesnt need much water. But i feel its a waste of all that material if u cant fill it even half way
customer_reviews.author: Jennyanddre

customer_reviews.title: Much larger than expected. My 6 year old daughter absolutely loves it!
customer_reviews.text: This is much larger than we expected! Due to how cheap it was I thought it would small, but my daughter, boyfriend, and myself can all fit. We couldn't swim but we can lounge. My daughter is 6 and can actually swim a little. The little blue baby pool was not fun for her anymore. Since this was so cheap I figured I'd buy it! Im very glad I did! We received it and she could not he happier!
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn't buy it
customer_reviews.text: I got this pool. Great Size, good depth for our tall 3-1/2 yr old. Used 3 times, the side wall pushed out and water was about 4 inches below the MAX WATER LINE found inside the pool. It then collapsed, causing it to rip and deflate. Of course I can't issue a return. I had to throw it away. We only got to use it 3 times because my daughter got sick and then had a bad allergic reaction so yea... it was a real bummer. I wish a took a picture of it in all the stages. Purchased this July 02, 2019... wrote this 08/07/19, BUT had broke officially 08/03/19. It is really disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna Sawicki

customer_reviews.title: Best $20 I've ever spent in the summer
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely love this pool. I'm not sure I've ever spent a better $19.99. It is plenty large enough for two grown adults to lounge in comfortably, and after over 5 uses, we've had zero issues. I do recommend putting a tarp underneath the pool to help protect the bottom from any sticks or rocks that might be under it. It is the perfect size, and you absolutely can't beat the price!
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Henry

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: This worked perfectly as a cooling station for my nieces and nephew during our July 4th BBQ. Unlike other reviewers I had no issues with holes or deflation - it is still holding most of the water 5 days later (though the base has begun to collapse). My only advice is to make sure you inflate it all the way so it's firm or it's not sturdy. Definitely worth the price but I wouldn't expect it to last more than one summer if that.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: EASY set up!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these pools for our 4th of July party and they were a hit. Easy to set up - I took the advice of another Amazon review and used our Shop Vac to inflate them. There were 3 kids at the party that jumped from pool to pool and then after my husband got finished BBQ'ing he jumped in to cool off. Great for big kids and little kids!! LOL. I was expecting to have to trash them after using them all day, but they were still in great shape. I rinsed them, hung them to dry and put them away for next time!
customer_reviews.author: KK

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: It was hard to pump up because the hole is so huge you can’t use a normal pump. I read someone used a hair dryer which worked but wasn’t able to pump it sturdy enough in my opinion. Figuring out how to reverse the vacuum will probably be the best bet next time we use the pool. Kids had a blast. My husband and I are about 5’ 5’ and we both can lay flat in it at the same time. Just relaxing it is a great size for the family. 3 adults can fit comfortably and for $20. Very happy
customer_reviews.author: D. Maile Higgins

customer_reviews.title: Bottom is not very durable
customer_reviews.text: Very nice size. However there are small holes in the bottom due to small sand rocks. I used a tarp under it to prevent it rubbing on the concrete but still the bottom plastic is not made very thick which makes it very easy to puncture. Mind you the VERY smallest of rocks was able to make a hole. It’s not a huge deal but I didn’t want a big circle a dead grass so I put it on my patio instead. I don’t think I’ll be able to reuse it next summer 😢 but my kids got a use out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Naydana

customer_reviews.title: If I could give it zero stars I would
customer_reviews.text: First the product did not include a patch kit like it said it did on the package. It needed one too. I set it up and filled it with water. The next day it was empty. The pool had a leak. Bad buy and waste of money. I never even got to use it. Also, I thought it was funny that the picture of the pool had an adult sitting on the side of the pool, when i the instructions it clearly says not to do that.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa jones

customer_reviews.title: Great, cheap fun!
customer_reviews.text: My 16 mo old seemed to be bored in her smaller intex pool from last summer, and I wanted in with her! For $15, this was worth a shot! Can’t speak yet to the durability but even if it lasts just a few swims (hopefully not!), it was money well spent. Used on a deck and just put a moving pad under it for softness since there isn’t a “bubbled” bottom like the small bright 3 rings one. On the grass, it’s comfy! We only filled it a little bit for her, but then three adults joined her and we fit fine!
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Stands up to duck claws!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for ducklings to swim in fully expecting it to get popped after a few weeks. Duckling/duck claws are surprisingly sharp. But the price, at the time ($14.99), was worth it. We've had it several months now, ducklings are now almost full grown and swim in it daily, stand on the sides while they preen themselves, and the pool is still holding air and water. It's really amazing.
customer_reviews.author: KC06

customer_reviews.title: Goes flat within hours. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size. Won’t stay inflated. After only a month of use, we are throwing it out. Problems started from the very first use. We bought patches, gorilla tape, flex tape. It’s not working. We can’t keep up with the air leaks and we’re wasting so much water by having to reinflate every few hours or have it all flood out. Not worth the money. Contacted them and they would not do a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This large kiddie pool is fun for children-adults to cool off and splash in.
customer_reviews.text: This pool is surprisingly large for a kiddie pool, comfortable, easy to inflate and pretty hardy. I was happy that my 6 ft. teen, myself as well as my 5 year old could all splash and play in this pool together. I read reviews and bought a pool lounge so I could float, relax and tan. If I closed my eyes, I felt I was in any resort pool! Super happy with the amount of joy this pool has brought us for $14.99!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle W

customer_reviews.title: Won't hold air
customer_reviews.text: This was our 2nd intex pool this year. Both were fine the first year and then deflated within a half hour the 2nd use. We've wasted so much water and I've got disappointed kids again. At least it's not 100° out....oh wait. :( Amazon sent us a replacement pool. I opened it up and found that it had a big slit in the bottom. SO FRUSTRATING.
customer_reviews.author: Joyzabuggin

customer_reviews.title: Very good product would highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: This pool is great and attractive looking and much better than pictured. I got it for my six-year-old because I did not want something extremely deep and this was perfect. This is a more shallow pool but if she is sitting or stretched out it is long enough to still have fun with. It is easy to inflate and comes with patching. You must make sure it is on level ground and stays inflated as any part that start sagging will have water start overflowing from it. This is understandable.
customer_reviews.author: JessicaJazNY

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: I hate this pool. You have to have it on complete level ground or the water will cave the wall on the side it’s pushing more against. We can’t fill it as much as we’d like which makes it less desirable for the kids to play. Not too thrilled about draining the water to find a more level area of the yard because we just paid a $350 water bill from another failed pool we had prior that was larger.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Great pools for my two kids
customer_reviews.text: So far this pool has been sturdy even though my two kids have been pretty rough on it. It's a nice size that fits perfect on our deck and we love that it has a water release on the bottom so we can refill it every few days with fresh water. Hopefully it will last the rest of the summer. We've had many blow up pools over the years and so far this has been the best.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Don’t use the bottom plug to release water.
customer_reviews.text: I used it for the first time yesterday and I went to let the water out of the bottom and the bottom *around* the plug popped out. This is so disappointing. I hadn’t even had it out of the box 24 hours and now it’s useless.
customer_reviews.author: Cory Holllis

customer_reviews.title: I bought this pool last summer and it was wonderful. I did not have any problems with tears ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pool last summer and it was wonderful. I did not have any problems with tears or holes. It shipped fast and showed up unharmed and in one piece. It was well made and held up for the whole summer. Unfortunately I didn't take care of it properly and that one got too gross for me to want to clean at the end of the summer so it did not get stored away for re-use. I have ordered a new one for this year and look forward to another fun summer in the pool with the kids.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer S

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids
customer_reviews.text: If the pool had a plug in the bottom I would have given it 5 stars. The pool is big enough to lay two mattresses side by side if you want to lay and pretend you are floating in a big pool. Or you could let the little kids use it and sit on the sidelines. Honestly, it is a pain in the rear to empty and refill when it gets dirty but I purchase a new one every year so it must not be that bad.
customer_reviews.author: paula

customer_reviews.title: High quality and very durable
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd time purchasing this pool and they are fantastic. I use this pool for myself (no kids) and it is the perfect size. I can get in it with my float and close my eyes and be anywhere I want to be. It's very well made with excellent quality. I recommend placing pool on a tarp for extra durability. I would highly recommend this pool. It's well worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good Value, Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: Only had a chance to use a few times last Summer. It blows up easily using my compressor and stays inflated. It's the perfect size for a couple adults relaxing in the sun. It seems pretty durable and the sides stand up against the waters weight very well. It deflates pretty fast when you need to put it away. No issues encountered.
customer_reviews.author: Robbie W

customer_reviews.title: Eh
customer_reviews.text: This is our third day using it and so far it’s holding up well. I bought the Intex air machine as well to blow it up. I will update at the end of the summer to let you all know how it held up. UPDATE- have used maybe five times and the side is collapsing and it won’t hold the water. Super frustrating because my kids loved it.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia hansen

customer_reviews.title: It works for the price
customer_reviews.text: Easy and quick to inflate with a mattress pump or a hair dryer (on low cold! ) as suggested by another reviewer. Unfortunately, the bottom ring has a slow leak SOMEWHERE. We set it up in the afternoon, by the next morning it's half flat and we have to refill it. I mention this only because it seems to be a common complaint. The drain plug likes to suction closed when draining, so put something in the hole to prop it open. I stick a pencil in the ground,in the hole. It does the job for our week end uses but I won't be buying another one when it's time to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Deflates very quickly
customer_reviews.text: the pool deflated almost instantly after inflating. Will not hold air. I called amazon to let them know and they said I could exchange or get a refund. I decided to do a refund! Sad that the pool didn’t work out, but so glad amazon has Great customer service !
customer_reviews.author: Natalie C.

customer_reviews.title: Leaked straight out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Save yourself the hassle. Like several others here, the pools upper ring refused to hold air before we ever got around to adding water. Thankfully I got a wonderful Amazon rep in chat and since time was short (had kids arriving that the pool was to be used by, but leaving in three days) she set me up with a pool that offered 1 day shipping, did a price match and waived the shipping cost. Providing the new pool holds air I'm happy with her helping me out of a tough situation. I've owned Intex products in the past with no issues, but this pool just didn't make the grade.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Kids love this!
customer_reviews.text: My children pooled (all puns intended) their birthday money to buy this for themselves. It's excellent value for the money. It inflates easily with the pump we have. There is a plug in the corner to pull to let the water out when you are ready. I liked the idea to put a fitted sheet over this to keep the mosquitoes from laying eggs in the water, so we will do that. The pool is plenty big for both my kids to play without bumping in to each other. They are 6 and 13.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Sterikoff

customer_reviews.title: Large, durable inflatable pool for the price!
customer_reviews.text: This is such a NICE large pool for a romp out on a hot, sunny day! My kids loved it! It is also not so high that they cant get in/out of it themselves. I have a 3 year old and a 5 year old who both had no problem getting in and out. They were not easy on it and I was happy to see that it seems to take a bit of a kid beating and will last. Hello durability! Exactly what is needed in an inflatable pool! As we put it away it was easy to deflate and fold up and store. Great price too! Very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: reemsco30

customer_reviews.title: Its a pool
customer_reviews.text: Holds water and air. Initially had trouble keeping the drain plug closed but it's just a snug fit...would order again. Please note that we inflated this pool w/ease only because we had previously purchased an intex powered blower. The air plugs are a large size so you may need a special attachment to blow it up with a regular air compressor.
customer_reviews.author: sbarna411

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed with this purchase. We’ve had an intex pool in the past, but wanted this slightly smaller one. It hasn’t stayed inflated since the day we bought it. Always inflated on grass. Contacted the seller on here and they told me to contact intex. I contacted intex, I’m pretty sure I’ll never hear back. This wasn’t a cheap pool so I’m disappointed with the quality.
customer_reviews.author: JK Bauer

customer_reviews.title: Durable pool that can last multiple summers
customer_reviews.text: My three year old and six month old had the best time in this pool. It was large enough for them to move around but still small enough to keep them at arms reach. It's durable and made to last. For the price I purchased this a a throw away pool but was pleasantly surprised by the quality. I could see this lasting for at least two summers if it were cared for correctly. Over all it was worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Seth L

customer_reviews.title: Cheap pool and waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your money on this pool. It deflates and you constantly have to keep air in it even though there is no leak or hole. Wish they made the old hard plastic pools we used to have in the 80’s
customer_reviews.author: RC

customer_reviews.title: Did the trick!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this last minute using my Prime account as soon as I saw there was a heat wave headed our way!! All of the stores nearby were no longer selling pools and our house has no a/c so I was desperate to find something to get the kids through the weekend. Arrived just in time and was blown up in about a minute. Everyone loved it . . . there's plenty of space to comfortably fit 6 adults. I would recommend just letting the air out of it to empty the water. It's a waste of time to try and use the little plug on the bottom!
customer_reviews.author: Lee Fam

customer_reviews.title: Horrible air plug design
customer_reviews.text: So it's a nice sized pool, however the air plugs are poorly designed. They pop right out! So when I kid pushes against that side, they pop out of place. We just opened it today, the kids have been in it 2 hours and I'm ready to toss it. Very frustrating! I'd return it but I'm not going to try to stuff it in the box after trying to get it dry.
customer_reviews.author: R.Harder

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: I used to put a float in and lay out in the sun. Perfect size for one person wanting a tan. 6 foot by 3 foot. Also when i wasn't using it for myself i let my niece use it to swim
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Williams

customer_reviews.title: Inflated badly out of shape, and it just got worse in the sun.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had a few versions, and generally they last pretty well. But this one had something go wrong at the factory, because the rings were not even close to being even, with big bulges and constricted areas. Inflated badly out of shape, and it just got worse in the sun. Probably just a bad batch of vinyl??
customer_reviews.author: Mankx

customer_reviews.title: Buy patch kit along with this pool
customer_reviews.text: We’ve bought this same style pool before and had great luck with it lasting two summers, but have been disappointed this summer with this latest one getting multiple holes along the seams and along the clear wall plastic. I think my patience of patching trying to not have such a huge waste of plastic go into the landfill has me thinking to skip these cheap disposable pools altogether.
customer_reviews.author: Mize Fam-Bam

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for. I bought this ...
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. I bought this to float in during my third trimester in the Virginia heat. No kids even rough-housed in it, no dogs were in it...my point is, my using this pool was as gentle as it gets. I used this one time and upon inflating the second time, it had holes and wouldn't hold air. We tossed it out and headed to Walmart and got a comparable/bigger pool for the same price.
customer_reviews.author: A+C Burke

customer_reviews.title: GREAT bargain
customer_reviews.text: For $15, you can not go wrong with this product. Had it ready to go in 10 minutes. It lasted the whole summer and is stored away for next year. Spacious enough for my wife and 5 year old daughter, (and sometimes me). It was durable, had a great water level, and my little lady enjoyed it all summer. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Michael C Kaledas

customer_reviews.title: it drains pretty fast so I don't know what other people were ...
customer_reviews.text: The biggest concern I had was the drainage, it drains pretty fast so I don't know what other people were complaining about. The flap on the drain does like to suction closed so that is a little of a pain. I just put a rock on it to keep it open. Besides that it is a good size pool.
customer_reviews.author: Melbren

customer_reviews.title: Performed as expected.
customer_reviews.text: Size was perfect for a couple of 3-4 year olds. They climbed all over it and it held up just fine. We put a little tykes slide at one end and they played all day.
customer_reviews.author: Karen H.  OKC

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last long
customer_reviews.text: Update: after two weeks there was a hole. We tried using a patch we bought bc there was not one in the box and it didn't seal. Our son loved it but didn't last long at all. Used it 3xs Our 2 year old son loves it! Perfect size! Haven't had any problems with it.
customer_reviews.author: Byrom

customer_reviews.title: The kids have a ball in this pool
customer_reviews.text: This pool was an awesome buy! I'm even thinking about purchasing another one just to have as a backup. This pool is a good size. It fit my daughter, niece, and 2 nephews in it at the same time. We added a slide to it that we already had, some balls and turned it into a kids' pool party! Definitely recommend getting this pool!
customer_reviews.author: C Clark

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made and does not hold air !!!!
customer_reviews.text: The pool would not stay inflated . Changing the water the second time I pulled the plug and it completely tore off the top and valve is connected to the liner that tore around the valve !!!!! Ridiculous after one week and the hottest weather . Don’t recommend at that pricing either !!!
customer_reviews.author: Dody

customer_reviews.title: AIR PLUGS POP OPEN
customer_reviews.text: Used this for the first time today. Spent time putting air in. Filling with water with help of excited grandchild. 3 minutes after she got in the water the air plugs popped open. It deflated and all the water was wasted. The plugs do not stay closed. Day wasted. Little girl crying. Boo.
customer_reviews.author: Ouijah

customer_reviews.title: is that this pool is sturdy, safe
customer_reviews.text: Gift to my grandson. Only one problem, he never wants to get out of the pool. Personal observation after seeing him in it, he's 4 btw, is that this pool is sturdy, safe, and really, really big for a young child. Totally stable, even for "diving" into the pool, well, more jumping really, and is a solid product. Highly recommend it for the young ones in your life who love pools.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Lagana

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it
customer_reviews.text: Bigger than I thought it would be but I love it. Easy to assemble. One thing I didnt realize was that it has maximum water level and I over did it hahaha my fault I didn't read it in the pool but it didnt break or anything. I do have to keep putting air every day, makes sense since THE SUN hits it. The sun will make inflatables deflate. I like it no complains, kids love it.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Great for adults too!
customer_reviews.text: I use this pool every weekend. I have it on my patio, keep it filled with a little chlorine float and a cover during the week. I get in it and sit in the sun, using it to cool off. It's a budget friendly way to enjoy the outdoors, get some sun, and splash around. Super durable too!
customer_reviews.author: Ellen

customer_reviews.title: Great pool
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this pool for my 4 year old son that does not like going in the big above ground pool that we have. My son loves playing in this pool, and there is plenty of room for all his pool toys and for when his friends come to visit and play in the pool with him. My 11 year old daughter also enjoys playing in this pool with my son. This pool is easy to set up, but you will need some kind of air compressor because it is too big to attempt blowing it up yourself.
customer_reviews.author: GPolly

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't hold air for long
customer_reviews.text: We just had a beautiful weekend and my girls were so excited to play in their new intex inflatable pool; however, the pool isn't holding air for more than 2-3 hours. So if they play in the pool in the morning and come back to it in the afternoon it's flat and we have to blow it up again. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Alana Sims

customer_reviews.title: I love my personal pool
customer_reviews.text: Do not want to maintain pools so I got this one to fill when I want to use it for a weekend. I used it last weekend and OMG it was perfect. Can have several people it. I can lay on my floaty in it. I'm 5'1" and laying down arms and legs stretched it still has a little space. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Lee Rosenhahn

customer_reviews.title: Air leaks out of the box
customer_reviews.text: We have bought two of these pools this year. Both times we thought we had caused an air leak by some how putting a hole in the pool. Tracing the leaks show a scatter of small holes in different locations around the pool vinyl. This appear to be a defect from the factory.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy and Lee

customer_reviews.title: Awesome alternative for small back yards
customer_reviews.text: Have had this out all summer and it's been great. My 3 year old loves it. My wife lays out in it with him and she enjoys it. Would love a bigger pool, but with a small back yard this worked out great. Took a little bit to get it pumped up, but it isn't tiny so that was to be expected.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Peterson

customer_reviews.title: If its not completely lever underneath it kinks on one side!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not saying it isn't possible I managed to get a hole in it from the box to the outdoors but the bottom ring had a hole and I didn't bother contacting the seller. Maybe just a freak thing, but the kinking if you don't have it completely level underneath does happen its a bummer, lose water then.
customer_reviews.author: BUTCHPOET

customer_reviews.title: This pool does not stay inflated
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pool for my kids we blew up the pool and it seemed fine until it was almost completely deflated. We blew it up again thinking maybe the plugs weren't in properly even though they seemed to be. Nope completely deflated looked for holes none to be found. the plugs were in. I am confused as to why it deflated but we returned it for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: H Nowakowski

customer_reviews.title: Not very durable
customer_reviews.text: We used this only a handful of times. It almost immediately got a hole on the lower chamber. Well we continued to use it and only deflate the upper part. Well we went to deflate it and the plastic part that you put air into came off completely. It is unusable now only after a few used.
customer_reviews.author: Alexy007

customer_reviews.title: Beware Over Priced Item!!!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve bought other Intex pools. It’s good quality and durable. Last longer than other pools we had. I just wouldn’t buy it from a seller that is clearly price gouging the item. Learned the hard way. This pool is sold at Walmart for $23.70 for the same brand and size. Target has a slightly bigger pool for $30 same brand. Pool rating ⭐️ ⭐️ ⭐️ ⭐️ ⭐️ Seller rating 🤬
customer_reviews.author: aMOMzon

customer_reviews.title: Didn't hold air
customer_reviews.text: Never even got to use it. Filled up with air and water, hour later entire top ring was deflated. Filled up with air again, same result. No way to tell where air is leaking from. Pain to dry it off, shove it back in the box and drive it to the UPS store. We've bought this pool previous summers and have had no problem.
customer_reviews.author: MK

product_meta.title: Intex Swim Center Family Inflatable Pool, 103" X 69" X 22", for Ages 6+
product_meta.description: Intex Recreation Swim Center Family Pool, Age 6+. Turn the water on slowly at first to allow water to gradually fill in. Then adjust the spray as desired
feature_bullets: The dimensions are 103" x 69" x 22", 14 gallon vinyl pool
Capacity is 198 gallons. Also comes with a shelf box. Includes a repair patch
2 air chambers each with double vavle intake and free-flow exhaust vavle

Do not lean, straddle, or exert pressure on the inflatable wall or side wall as injury or flooding could occur. Do not allow anyone to sit on, climb, or straddle the sides of the pool. Pools are subject to wear and deterioration. Properly maintain your pool. Do not install the pool on mud, sand, soft or loose soil condition, deck, platform, balcony, concrete, asphalt or any other hard surfaces
NOTE: Refer the User Manual before use.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
